item.title: THINGS BILL GATES DOES NOT KNOW: EUROPEANS EVOLVED PALE SKIN ROUGHLY 8500 YEARS AGO
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
How Europeans evolved white skin

By Ann GibbonsApr. 2, 2015 , 5:00 PM

ST. LOUIS, MISSOURI—Most of us think of Europe as the ancestral home of white people. But a new study shows that pale skin, as well as other traits such as tallness and the ability to digest milk as adults, arrived in most of the continent relatively recently. The work, presented here last week at the 84th annual meeting of the American Association of Physical Anthropologists, offers dramatic evidence of recent evolution in Europe and shows that most modern Europeans don’t look much like those of 8000 years ago.

The origins of Europeans have come into sharp focus in the past year as researchers have sequenced the genomes of ancient populations, rather than only a few individuals. By comparing key parts of the DNA across the genomes of 83 ancient individuals from archaeological sites throughout Europe, the international team of researchers reported earlier this year that Europeans today are a mix of the blending of at least three ancient populations of hunter-gatherers and farmers who moved into Europe in separate migrations over the past 8000 years. The study revealed that a massive migration of Yamnaya herders from the steppes north of the Black Sea may have brought Indo-European languages to Europe about 4500 years ago.

Now, a new study from the same team drills down further into that remarkable data to search for genes that were under strong natural selection—including traits so favorable that they spread rapidly throughout Europe in the past 8000 years. By comparing the ancient European genomes with those of recent ones from the 1000 Genomes Project, population geneticist Iain Mathieson, a postdoc in the Harvard University lab of population geneticist David Reich, found five genes associated with changes in diet and skin pigmentation that underwent strong natural selection.

SIGN UP FOR OUR DAILY NEWSLETTER

Get more great content like this delivered right to you!

First, the scientists confirmed an earlier report that the hunter-gatherers in Europe could not digest the sugars in milk 8000 years ago, according to a poster. They also noted an interesting twist: The first farmers also couldn’t digest milk. The farmers who came from the Near East about 7800 years ago and the Yamnaya pastoralists who came from the steppes 4800 years ago lacked the version of the LCT gene that allows adults to digest sugars in milk. It wasn’t until about 4300 years ago that lactose tolerance swept through Europe.

When it comes to skin color, the team found a patchwork of evolution in different places, and three separate genes that produce light skin, telling a complex story for how European’s skin evolved to be much lighter during the past 8000 years. The modern humans who came out of Africa to originally settle Europe about 40,000 years are presumed to have had dark skin, which is advantageous in sunny latitudes. And the new data confirm that about 8500 years ago, early hunter-gatherers in Spain, Luxembourg, and Hungary also had darker skin: They lacked versions of two genes—SLC24A5 and SLC45A2—that lead to depigmentation and, therefore, pale skin in Europeans today.

But in the far north—where low light levels would favor pale skin—the team found a different picture in hunter-gatherers: Seven people from the 7700-year-old Motala archaeological site in southern Sweden had both light skin gene variants, SLC24A5 and SLC45A2. They also had a third gene, HERC2/OCA2, which causes blue eyes and may also contribute to light skin and blond hair. Thus ancient hunter-gatherers of the far north were already pale and blue-eyed, but those of central and southern Europe had darker skin.

Then, the first farmers from the Near East arrived in Europe; they carried both genes for light skin. As they interbred with the indigenous hunter-gatherers, one of their light-skin genes swept through Europe, so that central and southern Europeans also began to have lighter skin. The other gene variant, SLC45A2, was at low levels until about 5800 years ago when it swept up to high frequency.

The team also tracked complex traits, such as height, which are the result of the interaction of many genes. They found that selection strongly favored several gene variants for tallness in northern and central Europeans, starting 8000 years ago, with a boost coming from the Yamnaya migration, starting 4800 years ago. The Yamnaya have the greatest genetic potential for being tall of any of the populations, which is consistent with measurements of their ancient skeletons. In contrast, selection favored shorter people in Italy and Spain starting 8000 years ago, according to the paper now posted on the bioRxiv preprint server. Spaniards, in particular, shrank in stature 6000 years ago, perhaps as a result of adapting to colder temperatures and a poor diet.

Surprisingly, the team found no immune genes under intense selection, which is counter to hypotheses that diseases would have increased after the development of agriculture.

The paper doesn’t specify why these genes might have been under such strong selection. But the likely explanation for the pigmentation genes is to maximize vitamin D synthesis, said paleoanthropologist Nina Jablonski of Pennsylvania State University (Penn State), University Park, as she looked at the poster’s results at the meeting. People living in northern latitudes often don’t get enough UV to synthesize vitamin D in their skin so natural selection has favored two genetic solutions to that problem—evolving pale skin that absorbs UV more efficiently or favoring lactose tolerance to be able to digest the sugars and vitamin D naturally found in milk. “What we thought was a fairly simple picture of the emergence of depigmented skin in Europe is an exciting patchwork of selection as populations disperse into northern latitudes,” Jablonski says. “This data is fun because it shows how much recent evolution has taken place.”

Anthropological geneticist George Perry, also of Penn State, notes that the work reveals how an individual’s genetic potential is shaped by their diet and adaptation to their habitat. “We’re getting a much more detailed picture now of how selection works.”Posted in: 

  • Archaeology
  • Biology
  • Europe
  • Evolution
  • Human Evolution

doi:10.1126/science.aab2435

Ann Gibbons

Ann is a contributing correspondent for Science.

  •  Twitter

item.title: FEELING CHARACTER OF MORAL JUDGMENT IS THE ROOT OF AESTHETIC FEELINGS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: I am still examining Complex Pleasure of Stanley Corngold. For the past several years I have been slowly learning about psychology of emotions, and I am glad to have the work of Professor Corngold who is a true master for literary feeling. Precise understanding of emotions especially regarding moral judgments and more subtle literary feelings have not yet been understood precisely and accurately. Not so long ago I was looking at the work of Adam Smith on Moral Sentiments, of Rene Descartes on Passions of the Soul, and Charles Darwin on Expression of Emotions. It is clear that precise mapping of Human Emotions will still require some time. I am actually interested in having deeper understanding here, and will admit to be being a novice still. Here I will note down the source of literary feeling in religious mythologies and their corresponding emphasis on moral judgments. I was looking for a solid base from which to appreciate the subtleties of literary feeling, and the beginning of all human feelings is in actual historical formulations of mythologies, and their vagaries and variations that are the primitive sources of more sophisticated literary feeling.

item.title: DOODLE'S FOR FUNDAMENTAL THEORIES OF MORAL FEELINGS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: The most remarkable feature of human moral values is that they are universally uniformly distributed across the globe, independent of ethnicity, race, and language and culture. This is the solid foundation, one of my great discoveries in the past few years. After that you have the drama from their conflicts and tensions. And this is the simplest way to consider the formation of complex forms in cultures and civilisations, the capture in civilisational memory of what resolutions there exist in conflicts, and the superior forms of solutions become divine mythologies.

item.title: FRIEDRICH SCHILLER'S AESTHETIC EDUCATION OF MAN
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: What I adore about Enlightenment Classical Liberals like Friedrich Schiller is that they had a nice story that is beautiful and could be grasped in its totality. For example Schiller contrasted state of nature to organisation of moral men, quite seriously, and saw the human race in terms of organisation of moral men. He emphasized natural laws to moral laws as action of exercise of liberty. This is such a pleasant story and it is so easy to understand in totality compared that it immediately moves me. Now I am a gifted scientist, and so I like these parsimonious stories a great deal. I like that the concepts are both sensible and easy to understand and that they are attempting to grasp actual human race with some validity. I adore this sort of clear and beautiful story even if it is wrong, because it is a beautiful abstraction, and I can then look at the measured data to adjust it. This part is new, because Friedrich Schiller did not have World Values Survey. But it's really nice his story, because his story in the context I am putting it immediately tells us how Adolphe Quetelet's "average man" is a refinement of state of nature. My discoveries about universal distributions of Human Universal Values then allows me to consider one day adjusting the Friedrich Schiller story, and get something a bit more correct. What I don't like are confusing stories that are incoherent. In the end Nature is mysterious beyond human grasp; so then why confuse ourselves with stories that are incoherent and too difficult to comprehend quickly. We are forced to compromise for we have limited capacity to comprehend complexity and be right about everything. Why not accept that it is just better to have a good simple story that is uplifting and roughly accurate? No story will be perfect about such a complex phenomena as the eight billion humans anyway, so why not simply accept the limitations and do something that is both beautiful and roughly correct?

item.title: ARE WORLD AND TEXT BOTH FICTIONAL?
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Paul de Man reading Nietzsche propounds the understanding that the world and text are both fictional. In 2021 I am not willing to accept this sort of idea at all. On one hand it is true in a trivial sort of way, that a given individual's totality of the world is at most a construction of sorts, and so it is fictional in that way, that the subjective world of a human being is not any faithful replica of any objective world at all and therefore 'fictional'. On the other hand, there is no deep substance at all to the claim to me. Maybe when I was still in my 20s this would seem an interesting direction, but today this direction is deeply without substance. All it tells me is that intelligibility of the world is not actually innate in us. I think Rilke's Fourth Elegy is far more beautiful and substantive in telling us something about what substance this point might have, that we human beings are uncomfortable in our interpreted reality unlike trees of life and migratory birds and powerful lions and other animals who are more comfortable and know absolute reality better. But to consider interpreted reality of human consciousness as 'fictional' is deeply misguided. It is so misguided that I can't even tolerate the denigration that it implies about our lives and the transcendent potential that resides in it. This idea that the world is 'fictional' is really just horribly wrong way to see things. I can't stand this at all. What is more valuable is to consider the striving that we possess to know the world, and consider this seriously as a difficult endeavour.

item.title: OPEN LETTER TO COMPARATIVE LITERATURE
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]

I claim knowledge of some aspects of Absolute Truth. I will begin with a full mathematical physics on which I had spent many years of my life. It is called Four-Sphere Theory. You can find notes here that ought to be accessible to you with a bit of effort. I will rush to important conclusions. The universe has existed for infinite time in the past, time is unidirectional and undeformable (so Einstein's Special Relativity is wrong). Eternal Recurrence is provable for the actual universe. The single law governing the macroscopic universe is a new law due to myself called S4 Electromagnetism (that differs from Schroedinger law and Maxwell law) and there is no gravity as a mass-based force in Nature. Eternal Recurrence is a mathematical consequence. Steven Weinberg thinks it's good; before he died Freeman Dyson said it's right. Brookhaven National Labs are testing it. Four-Sphere Theory is a glimpse of Absolute Truth of the external objective world. Here Eternal Recurrence is not a matter of faith or belief but a consequence of the best mathematical physics that exists. So within this existence, where the physical world is a continuously deforming hypersurface of the four-sphere of fixed radius $R=3075.69 Mpc$ all the phenomena that can have any objective existence exists.

I strongly take a negative view of all those who would reduce the world as simply a matter of fiction (such as Friedrich Nietzsche and his interpreter Paul de Man in Allegories of Reading). These gentlemen and many other are strongly misguided about existence of objective reality. It is an interesting question of whether it is valuable to have one's beliefs have ground in Absolute Truth which is much more difficult when one then attempts to gain some interpolation between physics and complex phenomena that are important to human lives. On one hand, the universe is Natural and there is not a God in the ordinary sense, but a vast part of the objective universe is purely electromagnetic and unknown, and I cannot give certain knowledge of what lies 'beyond the veil' in a sense although Four-Sphere Theory does provide some guidance for objective discovery. What is important of course is that I am not am empiricist positivist in the sense that Four-Sphere Theory is not purely empirical at all. It is a deeper accomplishment in theoretical physics as the deductions will match physics measurements but there are vast questions un-answered. I, for example, do not believe at all that life reduces to three-dimensional chemistry theories (the ones taught and used in this age everywhere). And I displace Quantum Electrodynamics altogether successfully. My viewpoint is that there is merit and value for individuals staying true to objective reality to some extent. Now Robert Musil was quite active in Man Without Qualities about living in a cold universe without moral charge but I have results showing that Moral Virtues do increase Life Satisfaction for the actual human race, and thereby we have stronger support for the Aristotelian theory of Virtue. These are my own results. We are definitely, thus able to find elements of absolute truth that can hold us to an objective Absolute Reality. That there are possibilities of interpretations that are infinite regardless, that are all consistent with Absolute Reality is indubitable, and certainly dogmatic reduction to narrow interpretations I do not promote. But I detest the suggestion that all fictional delusional worlds that man can produce are equal in their value. Many are extremely false, like the mythologies held by white supremacists like Bill Gates. These have no value whatsoever. They are indeed fiction and they are extremely vile and corrosive and harmful fiction. I don't tolerate fiction of this type.

item.title: PEOPLE IN LITERARY CRITICISM ACCEPT SOME TOTALLY WRONG ARGUMENTS ABOUT TRUTH
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
People in Literary Criticism say that people have been claiming to know absolute truth for 3000 years, and none of them have been compelling, ergo there is no absolute truth.

This argument is not valid. Consider a substantial example. Ancient Greek theorists had hypothesised atoms of matter. For several thousand years, there was no proof at all, and so it would be dismissed as poppycock or 'just theory' or whatever. Then Rutherford's experiments proved the existence of the atomic model in early twentieth century, so it was true all along but we could not verify it till early twetieth century.
Suppose that people over many centuries claim things about numbers. Some come in first century AD and say 2+3=34. Then in second century we have passionate advocates of 4+5=12 etc. So all of them are wrong until one day, some person maybe Peano or whoever says well 1+1=2 and 2+4=6 and so on. This cat, Peano is right so he is right. It does not matter than many people have claimed to have the right answers before. Now Literary Criticism people are of the inference that Peano ought to be dismissed in this case because many people claimed truth that did not stick, was not right. What's it to Peano? Peano is right so he's right. You cannot in fact make the inference that failures in a project for 3000 years has any bearing on whether the next attempt will fail or not. Absolute Truth is Four-Sphere Theory and that's just how Nature works.

item.title: SWEDEN YOU WANT THE OPPOSITE ONE I GOT A GOOD ONE FROM ELIOT
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
“You gave me hyacinths first a year ago;
“They called me the hyacinth girl.”
—Yet when we came back, late, from the Hyacinth garden,
Your arms full, and your hair wet,

I could not
Speak, and my eyes failed, I was neither
Living nor dead, and I knew nothing,
Looking into the heart of light, the silence.

Oed’ und leer das Meer.

item.title: RATIONAL APPROACH TO READING BEST QUALITY MATERIAL IN SELF-STUDY
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Many people are not in academia, where you will know what to read for profession; many are not as fortunate as me to have attended Princeton University which is one of the best universities in the world. So if you are filled with hunger for knowledge and reading, and you don't know where to find the best things what can you do? I recommend the following rational strategy. Go to the websites of courses at the very top universities in the world: Harvard, Oxford, Cambridge, Stanford, Princeton, etc. And then see if the course syllabi are available. Then just pick from these. This is an infinitely better option than wasting a lot of time. The professors at the best universities have their professional career in choosing the best things for their undergraduate classes. So they really do know what they are doing. You ought to use their service to select reading material. This is the safest way to keep junk reading from your life. The world is filled with junk material. Without experience you would not even know what is junk and what is very top notch. Use the Professors of top universities do this choice for you and in 95% of the cases, their choices will be very high quality.

item.title: ZULF DOES NOT LIKE THIS "ANTISOCIAL" AND "PROSOCIAL" BEHAVIOUR CLASSIFICATION AT ALL
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: I am too classical to find this nomenclature of "antisocial behaviour" and "prosocial behaviour" to be substantially correct at all. I think these concepts are not as valuable as the language of morals and virtues. I think this attempting to erase moral valuation altogether from study of behaviour is idiotic. Moral values matter universally and this direction is significantly worse because it leads to weaker explanatory power for the world we actually live in. Moral tension matters, and matters a great deal more than saying things about 'pro-social' and 'anti-social' as though these things are without moral context. There is nothing anti-social about beating the living bejezus out of a guy who raped your sister. You can call that anti-social all you like but that's not in a vacuum. It is totally wrong to do the same to some guy who did not do anything wrong. The idea of calling the behaviour 'anti-social' without moral context is not any great advance in scientific understanding of human nature.

I am a professional level coder and have had full time jobs as Senior Software Architect for Robert Reich's Ecosystems in 1998-1999 and can produce production quality software by myself without trouble. You can see the quality of my code from this sample. For me coding is a tool rather than a passion but I am good; I can do significant complex production systems as needed. I started coding in C++ with templates and STL and so on at Lehman for the first time in 1995, and have grown as a coder over the years. Coding is not my passion but my level is very good. In 2018 I took an interview for Swirlds and took a 3 hour exam with Codility and got A not A+ so I can get things done. I am language-structure oriented in coding. I believe strongly that careful use of language structure is the most important part of solution to engineering problems. I hate hacking and doing clever work-arounds for production systems because the gain in time during prototyping is much less than the nightmare for years when the deeper layers are shoddy as a result and then everyone suffers and no one wants to refactor deep levels of code. I do not work on front-end till I am sure that the backend solves major issues of the problem. I am a world class scientific mind, so I am much more concerned with scientific substance than about front-end gidgets and midgets. I do understand that front-end is important, but not at the expense of the fundamental infrastructure being weak.

Bill Gates is not a coder at all. He's just interested in seeing if the product looks good and whether he can sell things. He does not have any nontrivial coding skills at all and is atrocious in his assessment of coding talents. He's very bad and a liar. However he thinks he is good which is just delusional. item.title: NEVER SECOND-GUESS SOMEONE ELSE'S RISK DECISION OR TOLERATE THOSE WHO DO
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: [latexpage] There are eight billion people on Earth. Each of us have a unique personality. Each of also see the world vastly differently. This is serious and deep. Even if the world could be reduced to clear objective unambiguous facts, no one actually could have mastery over all such facts. This is the reality. Now suppose you have some institution called Blue Brotherhood of Investments. This is some fictional institution and among what they do is make risky investments. For whatever reasons, some people $P_1, \dots, P_K$ have been given authority to make risky decisions. It is clear that utility functions of $P_k$ will differ from each other. Let's say the world provides situations $s_1,\dots, s_R$ with $R>10^{20}$ and by whatever method $P_{10}$ decides that some money, say $\$2$ billion is worth investing in $s_{55}$. Then all other people ought to let $P_{10}$ take the risk without getting in their way. Second-guessing their risk decision will always produce different assessment of risk for $s_{55}$ and is not better for Blue Brotherhood of Investements. They are worse off for many reasons. First of all procedurally the institution will be in anarchy and chaos and paralysis because no one has the same utility function at all. Now if you don't think $P_{10}$ ought to have authority to make risky decisions, then fire $P_{10}$. But never get in the way of the risk decision.

item.title: ADAM SMITH IS FAR MORE SUBTLE THAN THESE MALEVOLENT EVIL CUNTS LIKE BILL GATES CAN COMPREHEND
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Adam Smith wrote Moral Sentiment before Wealth of Nations. He is a far more subtle cat than those, like Bill Gates, who thinks his own self-interest justifies arbitrary evil harm to others such as myself. He does not comprehend Adam Smith but only pretends to, like much else about this fake and deceptive Bill Gates.

This has been covered before, so I just quote.

The impartial spectator (Smith’s version of a conscience), which is built up over long experience, generally looks kindly on the pursuit of self-interest. It is, after all, nothing more than what everyone pursues. At the same time, the impartial spectator, impartial as he is, draws a sharp line between self-interest that is neutral in its effects on others and self-interest that harms others to benefit oneself. Such selfish behavior, Smith argues, creates strong disapprobation in our fellow man: 

“To disturb his happiness merely because it stands in the way of our own, to take from him what is of real use to him merely because it may be of equal or of more use to us, or to indulge, in this manner, at the expence of other people, the natural preference which every man has for his own happiness above that of other people, is what no impartial spectator can go along with.”[i]

The impartial spectator enforces external limits on self-interest, not the least of which is the condemnation of harming others for one’s own benefit. Self-interest is defensible as long as it is consistent with the demands of justice, and justice demands that we refrain from harming others. 

The felt judgement of the impartial spectator is supported by powerful internal motivators. While society is based in part on “[t]he uniform, constant, and uninterrupted effort of every man to better his condition,” according to Smith, it is also based on the need to be loved and earn the approval of those around us.[ii] These desires form the basis for a kind of socialized self-interest—the self-interest of individuals peacefully pursuing their goals, which include being members of a community. The desire of humans to be loved and approved of is what encourages individuals to pay attention to the impartial spectator in the first place. Our desire for sympathy and the approbation of others limits our self-interest to what is consistent with not harming others while at the same time fueling the progress that makes everyone better off.[iii]

This basic distinction between self-interest and selfishness is important for distinguishing Smith’s theory from its caricature as a defense of selfishness. The invisible hand that Smith postulates as the source of order in society, while it does not require active benevolence, does require justice. In other words, it requires that individuals not harm one another without provocation.[iv] Self-interest without justice makes society impossible because “[j]ustice […] is the main pillar that upholds the whole edifice. If it is removed, the great, the immense fabric of human society […] must in a moment crumble to atoms.”[v]  Fortunately, our desire for the approbation of our fellow humans binds self-interest to keep it consistent with the demands of sympathy and justice. Self-interest is therefore consistent with justice and propriety. Selfishness, the desire to better oneself without regard to even the demands of justice, is not.

item.title: WHO ELSE BESIDES MYSELF KNOW BILL GATES IS A HARDCORE WHITE SUPREMACIST?
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Found this

Bill Gates says no to sharing vaccine formulas with global poor to end pandemic

Health advocates blast Microsoft billionaire for saying patent protections on life-saving vaccines must remain

By JON QUEALLY
PUBLISHED APRIL 26, 2021 5:40AM (EDT)

Bill Gates (Getty/Jack Taylor)Facebook19.1KTwitterReddit1.5KEmail10commentssave

This article originally appeared at Common Dreams. It is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 License. Feel free to republish and share widely.

Bill Gates, one of the world's richest men and most powerful philanthropists, was the target of criticism from social justice campaigners on Sunday after arguing that lifting patent protections on COVID-19 vaccine technology and sharing recipes with the world to foster a massive ramp up in manufacturing and distribution — despite a growing international call to do exactly that — is a bad idea.

Directly asked during an interview with Sky News if he thought it "would be helpful" to have vaccine recipes be shared, Gates quickly answered: "No."

Asked to explain why not, Gates — whose massive fortune as founder of Microsoft relies largely on intellectual property laws that turned his software innovations into tens of billions of dollars in personal wealth — said: "Well, there's only so many vaccine factories in the world and people are very serious about the safety of vaccines. And so moving something that had never been done — moving a vaccine, say, from a [Johnson & Johnson] factory into a factory in India — it's novel — it's only because of our grants and expertise that that can happen at all."Advertisement:

The reference is to the Serum factory in India, the largest such institute in the country, which has contracts with AstraZeneca to manufacture their COVID-19 vaccine, known internationally as Covishield.

The thing that's holding "things back" in terms of the global vaccine rollout, continued Gates, "is not intellectual property. It's not like there's some idle vaccine factory, with regulatory approval, that makes magically safe vaccines. You know, you've got to do the trial on these things. Every manufacturing process needs to be looked at in a very careful way."

Critical advocates for robust and immediate change to intellectual property protections at the World Trade Organization when it comes to the COVID-19 vaccines, however, issued scathing indictments of Gates' defense of the status quo.https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?creatorScreenName=Salon&dnt=false&embedId=twitter-widget-0&features=eyJ0ZndfZXhwZXJpbWVudHNfY29va2llX2V4cGlyYXRpb24iOnsiYnVja2V0IjoxMjA5NjAwLCJ2ZXJzaW9uIjpudWxsfSwidGZ3X2hvcml6b25fdHdlZXRfZW1iZWRfOTU1NSI6eyJidWNrZXQiOiJodGUiLCJ2ZXJzaW9uIjpudWxsfSwidGZ3X3NwYWNlX2NhcmQiOnsiYnVja2V0Ijoib2ZmIiwidmVyc2lvbiI6bnVsbH19&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1386342089923956740&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.salon.com%2F2021%2F04%2F26%2Fbill-gates-says-no-to-sharing-vaccine-formulas-with-global-poor-to-end-pandemic_partner%2F&sessionId=bd294d57cfac50515b81969696412414850df004&siteScreenName=Salon&theme=light&widgetsVersion=1890d59c%3A1627936082797&width=550px

Nick Dearden, executive director of Global Justice Now, one of the lead partner groups in an international coalition calling for WTO patent waivers at a crucial meeting of the world body next month, characterized Gates' remarks — and the ideological framework behind them — as "disgusting."Advertisement:

https://imasdk.googleapis.com/js/core/bridge3.476.0_en.html#goog_86725180Anthony Scaramucci breaks ranks with Donald Trump, supports Biden00:29 / 01:57Go To Video Page

"Who appointed this billionaire head of global health?" asked Dearden. "Oh yeah, he did."

Journalist Stephen Buryani, who on Saturday wrote an in-depth Guardian column on the urgent need for the patent waivers and technology sharing, offered a similarly negative view of the billionaire's "awful" arguments against sharing the vaccine technology.

Gates, charged Buryani, "acts like an optimist but has a truly dismal vision of the world."

During the Sky News interview, Gates said it was "not completely surprising" that the richest nations like U.S., U.K. and others in Europe vaccinated their populations first. He said that made sense because the pandemic was worse in those countries, but said he believed that "within three or four months the vaccine allocation will be getting to all the countries that have the very severe epidemic."

item.title: DO I LOVE MY SIBLINGS AND PARENTS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: I am reading Extinction and the attitude of the protagonist toward whether he loves his parents and brother who died and the surviving sisters is interesting. He says that he fended off questions about how much he loves them with naturally but does not actually answer them. There are two issues here that are deep. First there is a question about whether I myself love my parents and siblings. Well naturally, and the moment I can get some damn investment bank to get me the risk that Madam Lagarde took I will certainly give money to my brother Feroze Alamgir Ahmed and aunt and my mother at her deathbed. Bill Gates' malevolence was with knowing quite well that when he blockaded my $120 million he was stopping me from doing my duty as the eldest son to give her some financial assistance. And if you are normal, you will find it quite unforgivable. But you see, I have already decided that I will wipe out the miserable wretched lowlife cunt from the face of existence for many other reasons as well, mostly for the sake of my beloved people the human race. His ugly mug will only be around for so long. He is the cuntiest cunt on Earth and he is the most deserving of a beating that breaks all his bones before a really really painful death where no one cares that he is dead afterward. And you could say that my hardcore view of what Bill Gates deserves is a way in which I express my love for my family. I like that sort of thing, where I am plotting to wipe out a cunt from existence, but generously interpret it in terms of love for my family, my mother and siblings. Now that is also interesting is just how powerful closeness to one's family is to well-being and life satisfaction for all human beings. The key to loving your family, ladies and gentlemen, is not to get sucked into their drama but retain your own life. Then they are not going to get on your nerves.

item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Looking over Sleepwalkers which is a trilogy The Romantic, The Anarchist, and The Realist about three people just turn of twentieth century I suddenly realise that there is an external perspective to myself. I have been so internal all my life that I forget too easily that there is an external perspective to me at all. I am desperate for a decent life in San Francisco but was accosted by a malevolent criminal man, Bill Gates, who, learned is quite interested in ruling the world and a proponent of enslavement and misery based on ethnicity. The absurdity of the moment is just out of this world. Anyway, I am quite proud of my Conscience, and my embrace of my beloved people the human race, and I found that I am a remarkably good person in this process, which is a relief. It would be quite embarrassing if at 48, besides not having any income at all despite a Princeton education, I was surprised to find that most people on Earth are actually better people morally than me. That would be quite devastating. I am pleased that I am not the Underground Man of Dostoevsky. But on the other hand it is rather unfair that I have to be the hero and take down a Baddie suddenly at this age instead of pursuing my great projects peacefully right in the middle of America, the land of the free home of the braves and so on. Now what is interesting is the issue of dissolution of faith, morals and reason that Broch was writing about. I am extremely pleased with myself in having found uniformity in moral values across the human race. This is one of the most optimistic discoveries for the entire human race, because it allows us to understand that there is a stronger basis for morals than arbitrary deviations of fashions and moods of the times. And it was I, Zulfikar Moinuddin Ahmed, who discovered this positive truth about Nature for my beloved people the Human Race.

item.title: BILL GATES THERE IS NO ETHNIC SUPERIORITY THAT IS TRUE SO YOU CANNOT PROVE IT BY ANY MEANS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]You see Bill Gates, for superiority requires concrete metrics that people can agree on. There are 8 billion people on this world. Whatever metric you choose, you will have variations for people and you will fail to prove any superiority. Many people in America use IQ measures to try to claim whites are superior to blacks. Well IQ standard deviations are not zero. They are quite broad. And so even if the means differ, you will get substantial percent of black people well above white mean IQ. My IQ is 135-140. That is let us see, pnorm( 135, mean=100, sd=15) = 0.99. This means that by IQ metric I am superior to 99% of white people. I have a magna cum laude from Princeton University from 1995, so I have been educated at one of the best universities in the world. These alone put me far higher than 99% American white people in intelligence and education. Of course these are not sufficient metrics at all. I am not at all athletic and was shot in the liver around 11-12 and so have no skills with tennis or basketball or running, so I will miserably be a failure in these things and be inferior to most Americans who do these sports. This is a simple exercise. I have had 5 or 6 female lovers in my life thus far and cannot compete with American men with conquest and bedding of 50-100 women. So I am inferior to them on their metrics of superiority, which might be count of women they had conquered. There is no agreed upon rules of superiority at all. How will you convince me such an absurd claim that 'whites are superior'. You sound like a fucking total idiotic moron with slogans like that.

Let me try to clarify the issue here further. When you say "whites are superior" the obvious interpretation is that the set of white people of Earth, around 780 million have some criteria $P_1, \dots, P_K$ which we can consider as metrics that determine superiority such that the following holds. Let $H = H_{whites} \cup H_{nonwhites}$ be the human race. Your broad slogan 'whites are superior' ought to translate to this:

$P_k( b ) \le P_k(a)$ whenever $b \in H_{nonwhite}$ and $a \in H_{white}$ for $1 \le k \le K$. In other words, there ought to be some set of criteria where all white people are better than all nonwhite people for these criteria, and furthermore that these criteria can serve as objective measures of superiority. That is the natural inference for such a broad claim. Now broad claims are not always invalid. For example "Mack trucks are bigger and heavier than scooters and bicycles" is true always and therefore there are claims that are true. So fine, you give me the criteria $P_1,\dots, P_K$ on which whites will be superior and then it might be fine. What I show in this note is that IQ is not good enough, and you will find other criteria that you cook up are not good enough to produce this discrimination either. Why is this? What distinguishes white people certainly is that all white people have pigmentation genes that are responsible for pale skin. So you could actually mean that the criteria for superiority is $P_1$ will be proportion of pheomelanin higher than eumelanin. By this criteria white people will be superior. But that's more or less about it. You will have a difficult time producing any other clean criteria at all. You see, the human race is actually a single race, and all human beings differ in genome to around 0.1% of loci where there are differing alleles. That means it will be quite difficult in the end to produce any substantial theory of racial difference that cannot be challenged. Your view has severe flaws in multiple respects. First, you imply that there exist (unknown) criteria $P_1, \dots, P_K$ that will both discriminate between whites and nonwhites and in addition that they are sufficient to be regarded as 'superiority' by ordinary English language. Neither in intelligence or moral values can you establish this because it is simply not true. But your error is deeper because in fact there are significant problems with biological and genetic race in science. Race is a fiction and so you face further difficulty in genetic differentiation of whites from nonwhites at all. All human beings have the same genes with minor differences in alleles. It is quite absurd to believe that there is sustained 'superiority' of $H_{whites}$ to $H_{nonwhites}$ with this situation being true. So you are just absurdly wrong and deluded.

Look, Bill Gates, you like to keep repeating 'whites are superior' in meta. Now this is a glib catchy phrase, and might appeal to some people, but it is not substantial and serious and will not withstand stronger scrutiny. Whether you like it or not, most people around the world today, white and non-white would like to stand on firm scientific ground rather than accept glib catchy slogans. So you have the task of producing some sense with substantial empirical backing to compel people. But you cannot actually do that, because there is no substance to the broad claim. I have worked in pattern recognition problems in pharmaceutical biotechnology, and let me tell you with vast data with samples of 780 million and 7 billion and so on, you will have an impossible time producing discriminatory patterns at all in the genome of so many people, let alone additionally compel people that the discrimination can be interpreted as 'superiority'. People are not trusting idiotic children where you bamboozle them with rubbish slogans and they follow your lead. I know you have had some success with US Government higher officials, but most people are not as gullible as them.

item.title: ISIS HAS SERIOUS CRIMES AGAINST WOMEN BUT SAM HARRIS AND OTHERS ARE WRONG TO CONSIDER THESE TO BE ISLAMIC
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
https://www.hrw.org/news/2015/04/14/iraq-isis-escapees-describe-systematic-rape#

ISIS is primarily composed of Saddam Hussein's military after they were disbanded. They are hardly Islamic religious authorities. I am quite annoyed at the propaganda that Sam Harris and others engage in pretending that ISIS represents any legitimate Islamic authority. They are criminals. Their understanding of Islam is quite rudimentary and wrong. I am not impressed with the arguments of Sam Harris at all. There are 1.5 billion Muslims on Earth whose morals are roughly the same as Christians. It is hardly intellectually sound for Sam Harris and others to promote the idea that it is Islamic to rape women. Why doesn't he worry more about how rapes are an order of magnitude higher in the West than in Asia? Islam does not actually promote any rapes; Muslim countries have some of the lowest rape rates on Earth. What is the purpose of his hateful propaganda?

Let's go through this. First around the world Muslims and Christians have roughly the same moral values.

muslims_wife_beating-1Download

You see the problem I have with the Sam Harris anti-Muslim propaganda is that he is dreadfully undereducated about Islam. Islam has a history from 650 AD and spans the world and has 1.5 billion people who are faithful to it. He pretends that the descendents of Mesopotamian and Egyptian Civilisation and the entire Islamic world consists of some primitive people of some sort. This is of course ludicrous, as Islam has managed to give meaning to the lives of billions of people over a long time. He is simply not aware of all of this. No intelligent scholar can actually just be 'anti-Muslim' without much better education on the history of the Muslim people. So conflating Islam with the work of criminal radical political agents from Saddam Hussein's military might be a slick trick to his audience, who are not educated Muslims but people who don't know much about Islam, but it's not exactly high scholarly strategy.

Let's look at rape rates of Muslim majority countries and Christian majority countries. I already showed that Asian rape rates are half on average from early 2000s-2018 to North America, and I expect that Muslim majority countries have similar lower rape rates. The data are UN Crime and Drugs data, quite respectable and credible. Now when you have a religion with large number of countries involved and you see much lower rape rates in aggregate than West, then it is obviously deceptive strategy to try to accuse Islam to be a religion that promotes rape. There are obviously lots of Muslims, 1.5 billion, and there are rapists among them, but the question is whether the population mean of rapists lower or higher than the West. I am 100% certain it is much lower among Muslim populations than Western populations. The culture in East is less sexually aggressive than West, and so rapes are much lower.

I don't understand what Sam Harris will accomplish by hostile and hateful propaganda against 1.5 billion people of Earth, who will still be around a thousand years hence. They will gain in prosperity and what is the point of conflict with them? Islam is quite strong in popularity, and so they will continue on and Sam Harris will have spread hatred against people he does not know to his groupies, and they will have no idea what large parts of the world is like but have hateful opinions. How is this 'enlightened'? What's the agenda exactly? It's not true that Muslims are plotting to harm Americans. Muslims, like most other people are trying to get on with their lives. What is Sam Harris doing with his?

Why am I writing this? I am not Muslim at all myself. I became an Atheist at six in 1979. I am American with a Princeton Education, but my Conscience is triggered here. I know that the vast majority of Muslims and Christians in the world are good people. I also know that 9/11 was Mossad sabotage with no Muslim involvement. Sam Harris is a privileged man in the West. It is totally wrong of him to spread hateful propaganda and hurt people indirectly -- the internet is filled with anti-Muslim hate speech featuring Sam Harris statements. Why does a privileged man in the West have any right to harm good Muslim people indirectly even when they have not harmed him? How is it responsible of people who give him privileges to tolerate this sort of malevolence?

Muslim rape rate estimated from 18 countries is around 4.7 per 100,000 per annum on average. The average over all of Europe is 35.1; the average over all of Americas is 65.9; the average over North America is 93.1. It is very clear that rape rates in Muslim countries is an order of magnitude smaller than in Western countries.

Rape rates of Muslims versus Western countries is just the tip of the iceberg. Islam is a successful religion from 650 AD. So billions of people just consider part of daily life. They believe in God and that God's will drives all things, and they are just part of the human civilisation. I don't understand what is so bright about denigrating them by falsehoods without any serious research in American media and talk shows. This is just hate-mongering to people who don't know much about lots of people and their cultures and lives. What's different about what Sam Harris does than Nazi anti-semitic agitators in the 1920s? I don't understand why anyone would do that.

I am not Muslim, but I do know Muslim people and I know what's on their mind. They are faithful to God, and believe that particular things are Holy and if they follow a certain type of good life they will have VIP passage to Heaven and eternal life in bliss by the favour of God, the Creator of the Universe. They don't particularly care about Americans or whoever. They believe they have the Secret Knowledge of all things and special passage to privileged favour of God. Now I happen to be not Muslim, and I am wise enough never to get involved in their faith. They will drive you up the wall if you have a different view because they have faith that they are right. I don't get into their business. Why? Because I know that I can't win. Why even bother? I think it's best to leave people with strong convictions alone. Their conviction is not for harming American people. Their conviction is that they and not the Americans have season tickets to Heaven and Americans who are not Muslims are totally not going to get the best treatment after the Last Judgment. Now I am just fine with that. I have my own faith, and do not spend so much time arguing with impossible people.

item.title: ROUSSEAU, SCHILLER, KANT AND THEN ZULFIKAR MOINUDDIN AHMED
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: A few years ago, after I was successful with Four-Sphere Theory, I switched to new problems in the realm of human race, to psychology, and began a new intellectual life. This is actually quite challenging for me, as I put in so many years of my life on problems that led to Four-Sphere Theory under financial stress and essential exile from American life without income that is reasonable. And I did get a large stack of books about Human Nature. I pioneered Quantitative Human Nature from data of World Values Survey. Eventually I came to realise that there are many things that need further advances in universal morality and human sciences. Some of these are extremely easy; it is extremely easy to refute absurd anti-Muslim war propaganda in the West based on a lot of hot air. But that's not particularly interesting. What is interesting is Universal Human Nature, and I spent some years showing the limited ethnicity effects on Universal Human Nature. Rousseau, Schiller, and Kant were bright, but they were not actually exactly right about Human Nature. The questions they addressed, however are important questions and are worth pursuing but their answers were inadequate. Now I am extremely displeased that on a Harvard tenure consider, Bill Gates intervened with huge heavy US Industrial meta to damage my exoskeleton and Harvard simply disappeared without any actual effort to do anything. These things are extremely unimpressive. Why is America letting this miserable wretched criminal murderer Bill Gates get away with irritating and harming a great American genius, and an Immortal genius at that? What is going on in America? Anyway I was considering some thoughts about Notes From the Underground that are interesting for there is here a critique of the influence of Rousseau, Schiller and Kant on the Underground Man. I am much more clear about where I see gaps, failure of marriages and single motherhood in the world bespokes of overemphasis on Individual Liberty in Classical Liberal philosophy. There are other issues that depend on not being able to have an accurate model of human being as well. Hey, if you have a good relationship with your business counterpart you might even bake a cake for their birthday. Those things are not bribes. They are called human relationship building. Bribes are something else, clear financial excess to sway big decisions especially against laws of Nations. A box of chocolates and a cooked meal or a bunch of bruch meetings for relationship-building is not a bribe but part of the pleasure of doing Finance and business. You're wasting your time on fluff if you consider these social lubricants to be bribes. They allow people to treat each other as human beings with real lives rather than cogs in a machine.

Fine I'll share with Goldman my own preferences. I am an urban cosmopolitan man and love socialising with good high caliber people. I like going to museums and have dinners and brunches with friends and acquaintances, literati, etc. Those things are part of having a civilised life for most people. I am going to be forming some companies and I will emphasize tea time 4-5 every day and good social life in San Francisco. Now good people and great people you can form friendships with are uncommon as personalities clash, the tastes are often not the same. We grow older and our college buddies are scattered around the world. We need socialising for well-being. Goldman should let people breathe, have dinners or friendships with clients or counterparties and socialise. Dinners, gifts, chocolates, etc. are just part of that show. Some people are reserved and that's fine. These things are part of necessary well-being. Bribes are something different. If you notice that after a complex process where someone advocated for some deal among competitors and suddenly their private portfolio includes large number of houses in San Francisco, do investigate the bias and perhaps bribes were involved. But don't get in the way of natural friendships and other relationships. Those are necessary for people. Don't become Gestapo Secret police on your employees. They will be miserable and Goldman will suffer lower motivation and performance. People need cultured life with real close relationships with whoever is appropriate.

item.title: ZULF SEES SLOW CONVERGENCE OF MY OWN INTERESTS TO THOSE OF BAKHTIN
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]

I did love Bakhtin's Dialogic Imagination from Princeton, the course of Caryl Emerson was influential to me. Quite independently I was obsessed for years on a number of issues of personal interest, from a scientific point of view, that did lead to a mathematical physics that is correct. Existence I wanted clear bounds on, and so Four-Sphere Theory gives us those bounds. There is linear time, and there is geometric movement in a static eternal four-sphere of radius $R=3075.69Mpc$. This is the overwhelming space of objective existence, the cold description of all that has objective existence, all things that exist. Now at this level of vast generality I have been able to give a full theoretical physics. From the sort of knowledge that Einstein and Weyl were looking for, a unified field theory, I succeeded finally in 2018, after a decade of effort. It is only after this success that I could examine much more difficult problems. The problem of knowing this sort of Absolute Truth, theoretical physics, laws of Nature, with certainty, mind you, true absolute knowledge, to only find that this will not tell us all that much about what we will know of the objective existence. And therein begins the much more difficult problem of understanding what we can grasp of this Existence even now given its fundamental rules in the physics sense. And I don't know the answer. Mikhail Bakhtin, writing in 1919-1921 was far bolder and more ambitious. He thought about things in terms of the world of experience and the world as represented in language. I can interpolate thus. Existence and her main physical laws do exist, but there is the question of what we can know about this objective world even in principle. Even with a compact universe there is combinatorial complexity of the possibility of knowledge. And if we pretended that we will ever know existence, and represent it by something small and constrained like human language, what will be be doing? In other words, suppose we ask the question, here, human being, you have Four-Sphere Theory, and the description of all physical (and metaphysical) processes of Existence. What can you do with human language to represent this Existence? And this immediately will bring us to the question of choosing in a combinatorially vast set of phenomena a small set of things. We can go backward as well, and say that here is a human language with words $w_1, \dots, w_N$ and now use these words to describe all things of Existence that are true. How far will you go? Is this is sufficient to describe Existence?

Intelligibility is not a serious issue here. We consider all statements composed of $w_1, \dots, w_N$ that are intelligible and true relative to objective Existence. We will see quite quickly that if all true statements are the denumerable set $T = \{ s_{\alpha} \}$ of statements that are true, we will not care all that much for this vast impossible to grasp text of all truth about Existence. We will want a tiny subset $T_0 \subset T$ that we will want to privilege. There are both scientific and aesthetic criteria that will allow us to subselect $T_0$. English Romantics like John Keats will say "Truth is Beauty". It is tempting to believe that Aesthetic criteria have special privilege in subselecting $T_0$ the set of true sentences about Existence that we can consider valuable.

It is at this point I can merge my interests with that of Mikhail Bakhtin. Human comprehension is quite limited. We have evolved from earlies mammals for 200 million odd years, and for perhaps less than six million years we have evolved our capacity for language. Perhaps all mythology, religion, science, and (verbal) art grew out from our seeking ways of representing some parts of $T_0$ in language. We want the Truth, and we crave for Beauty in the Truth, perhaps select those truths for their Beauty as an evolutionary adaptation for cognitive abilities. This is the center of the tension between Being and Existence that is beyond our Consciousness and what our Consciousness will grasp in language regarding it.

It is from Rilke's Duino Elegies that some of these ideas are becoming clear to me, especially the Fourth Elegy. To me it is fascinating how Bakhtin in Russia, quite independently from Rilke, was writing and thinking theoretically about extremely similar concerns.

We care about T. S. Eliot's The Waste Land as Truth in a much more significant way than yesterday's newspaper article on what Joe Biden said about the budget in Senate. This we will consider part of this $T_0$. Why do we do this? Well because we are constrained always by our mortality and so we are impatient to gaze deeply into mirrors of our own soul and see something profound. Our interest in $T-T_0$ diminishes instantly when we have that desperate feeling that we ought to have some Truth that is profound enough to matter. And yes, the Truth in our deep souls in the mirror we will always venerate, and that is biological in essence, for we will die in finite time.

item.title: NEW MOVEMENT FOR MORALITY PAST MAN WITHOUT QUALITIES AND EXISTENTIALISM
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]I became an Atheist when I was six in 1979, and now at 48 I have had some time to reflect upon the issues of moral nature of Man. In the West there has been a total disintegration of the issues of morality with the failure of religion during the First World War, and Robert Musil's Man Without Qualities really highlights the lack of classical character virtues of the protagonist. I am not particularly enthusiastic about joining a fundamentalist religious movement, whether Christian or Islamic, for this would not satisfy my soul. At the same time, I am thoroughly convinced that human moral nature exists strongly in the deep evolutionary genetic history and that the particular religious packaging of morals with a literal Almighty God is accidental matter. Stronger than the existence of God in the straightforward manner of empirical science is the universal moral nature of human race. This last is my sole discovery. I alone, for the first time in history have exhibited the empirical existence of universal moral nature of the human race. I want to point out how tremendous this achievement is in contrast to the impossibility of empirical evidence for existence of Almighty God, the Most Benevolent and Most Merciful.

Roughly universal human nature works this way. Suppose you take a set of moral values $V_1, \dots, V_P$. Effectively $P$ will be order of 50-100 and this is rough idea from a lot of experience that I have developed examining data and extrapolating by scientific intuition. The distribution of values $\delta_p$ for value $V_p$ will be roughly the same type for $1\le p \le P$. I call the simplest accurate model a combination of a Roussau Exponential and a Hobbes Exponential. It looks like a U shaped curve with an exponential distribution on the left side and also on the right. The left pole is Good; the right Pole (far outside the range 1-10) is Bad. The balance is set such that roughly 90-95% of people are on the Rousseau Exponential (i.e. Good going down towards less Good). Around 5-10% at most are in the Hobbes Exponential.

Society, therefore ought to spend resources according to this division; spend more resources being nice and nurturing to the 90-95% because they're Good and be harsh and punitive to 5-10% because they're Bad. I will claim that those on the Hobbes Exponential cannot improve at all without harsh discipline and punish methods; they might transition to the left one day but they require extremely harsh measures and will be predatory and parasitic by nature if treated well. This total picture is the simplest picture I claim for universal moral nature. It's empirical and it is not worthwhile getting confused about exact mechanisms. What is wrong is to do an either/or or 50-50. It's both Rousseau and Hobbes with 95-5 roughly on all $P$ values.

item.title: ZULF'S THOUGHTS ABOUT RILKE CRITICISM
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]Rainer Maria Rilke's Duino Elegies is one of the most profound genius in history of all of poetry in history of humanity. Compared to it even Eliot's The Waste Land is humdrum and pragmatic. I am just amazed at how bad the criticism of Rilke is when I look around. These guys who are sneering and snobbing all manner of things, sniffing with pretentiousness make me laugh. They do not understand a single thing of Rilke's poetry. It is astonishing to me. It requires a great deal more than just sneering with contempt to actually have sublime taste in poetry. It's a farce in Rilke criticism. Just amazing.

The sublime of Eliot's The Waste Land is a montage of fragments, say $f_1, \dots, f_Q$ and now I want to define a distance function $d: F \rightarrow \mathbf{R}$. This distance function is the distance to the viscerally physical world. This is just a rough tool. Given two fragments $f,g$ we say $g$ is more otherworldly than $f$ if $d(g) \ge d(f)$. The dynamic range of otherworldliness of each of the fragments of The Waste Land is quite large. For example, this fragment will have low $d(\cdot)$:

Now Albert’s coming back, make yourself a bit smart.
He’ll want to know what you done with that money he gave you
To get yourself some teeth. He did, I was there.
You have them all out, Lil, and get a nice set,
He said, I swear, I can’t bear to look at you.
And no more can’t I, I said, and think of poor Albert,
He’s been in the army four years, he wants a good time,
And if you don’t give it him, there’s others will, I said.
Oh is there, she said. Something o’ that, I said.
Then I’ll know who to thank, she said, and give me a straight look.
HURRY UP PLEASE ITS TIME
If you don’t like it you can get on with it, I said.
Others can pick and choose if you can’t.
But if Albert makes off, it won’t be for lack of telling.
You ought to be ashamed, I said, to look so antique.
(And her only thirty-one.)
I can’t help it, she said, pulling a long face,
It’s them pills I took, to bring it off, she said.
(She’s had five already, and nearly died of young George.)

Let's say we scale things and all the fragments in Eliot's The Waste Land fell in the interval $I=[0,1000]$.

My major contention is that Duino Elegies will have fragments fall in $J=[500,10000]$ by comparison. It is a sequence of poems that is explicitly quite a bit further off from the daily viscerally physical world, and in a sense it is all about distance from the viscerally physical world and it is in fact literal what Rilke does which allows us to grasp this far distant world using language as our guide. Eliot's totality of the world is cultural resonant world of all of human experience while that of Rilke's is precisely to bridge the gap between a truer world and 'our interpreted world'.

item.title: WHAT DO YOU MEAN BILL GATES WAS THE GOLDEN BOY?
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I am not exactly envious of anyone deemed to be the Golden Boy by United States Government, but severely disappointed. I, Zulfikar Moinuddin Ahmed, am the Immortal Genius. I am studying Walter Benjamin's essay on Goethe's Elective Affinities today. I am fascinated by the relation between truth content and material content of a literary work of art that Benjamin makes the central theme of this essay, and considering the resonance with my concept of distance measure from visceral physical reality that I had proposed for Eliot's The Waste Land and Rilke's Duino Elegies in the past few days. These are substantial issues far beyond the limited mind of this "Bill Gates" can comprehend, for he is a hick illiterate huckster who is incapable of understanding the most basic issues in America such as inalienable intrinsic Natural Rights of Individuals. I am most surprised that this malovelent murderous criminal was considered the Golden Boy in America at all. And I am even more surprised that the true great American, Zulfikar Moinuddin Ahmed, who is a genuine American Genius, is allowed to be assaulted without reprieve for more than six months without the United States Government bringing the criminal Bill Gates to justice, as one would expect in any civilised nation. This man, Bill Gates, is intellectually inept, and even after I tried for many months to explicate my great results that bound ethnicity effects on Human Nature moral values to between 6.5-9.5% of the total variation, he never stopped repeating like a moron 'whites are superior whites are superior' like a broken record. What sort of 'Golden Boy' has America been choosing? How did he gain control of US Justice Department decades ago and no one had any idea till the last few days? Why are we, the American people, paying large parts of our income to United States Government in taxes and the Government is incapable of doing its basic function of securing American Natural Rights as explicitly stated as the reason for existence of Government in US Declaration of Independence? This is the reality at the moment, the State of the Union, and this state is not impressive at all.

Walter Benjamin, being a good scholar puts his reading of Goethe's Elective Affinities with ground of Immanuel Kant. "Sexual commerce is the the reciprocal use that the human being makes on the sexual organs and sexual capabilities of another. This is either of natural uses such as procreation or of unnatural uses such as with one of same sex or non-human." Now I am most intrigued since I am working on some issues of this psychology of romantic coupling. For me, the Kantian inscription is unsatisfying, for I consider things a bit differently, from the perspective of evolutionary history of the past 200 million years and even in less complex mammals, the process of sexual contact has a complex number of aspects and are difficult to understand simply as the use of sexual organs and capabilities of another. Procreation certainly is a central issue, but sexuality is much more deeply tied to our fundamental nature as human beings and here Kant is given more credit for profoundness by Benjamin than I would prefer. Not only human beings for four to six million years but our mammalian ancestors for 200 million years before us have been sexual beings, i.e. produced progeny from sexual union, and therefore it is not simple to encapsulate clearly in a simple statement fundamentally correct description of this phenomena. So Kant's description of sexual commerce is not appropriate here.

In order to have some sense for reality here regarding sex, I just did a short analysis of probability of high life satisfaction as a function of justification of sex before marriage in 2017-2020 World Values Survey.

sex_just-1Download

The point of this exercise is just to show that sexuality and marriage are relatively mysterious still, and so certainly pure reason will not yield deep insights about them, which was Kant's main tool. Sexuality in actual human race is still not understood and was certainly not understood clearly during the time Goethe wrote Elective Affinities. This is something that is always a central concern in attempting to understand truth content of any work of art, that works of art are imaginative exercises which could be considered as attempt to understand some deep feature of human nature; they have to in the end still face empirical reality of human nature by other means such as measurements.

One of the problems that interest me is whether men and women are marrying the right person for each other. In an ideal world, we would all meet just the right person for us, get married, and not have any regrets at all. Restrictions on sexuality to marriage and constraints on divorce are some of the things that in that ideal world would be beneficial. But all bets are off if we are unable to match correctly and then these sorts of constraints actually hurt us rather than help us.

item.title: ZULF'S OWN THOUGHTS ABOUT MARRIAGE
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Mittler: Anyone who attacks the state of marriage, who undermines the foundation of all moral society in word or deed will have to reckon with me.

Zulf does believe in marriage now, but I consider it not the foundation of all moral society. Instead I believe that romantic love and close relationships have deeper foundations and marriage is an event for social announcement seeking social acceptance of something that has fundamental reality. I strongly am against marriage of those who have not established the deeper union already, of mutual love and respect that is the actual substance of interest. Marriage is just the outer hull to seal that substance. I hate people venerating marriages that are hollow and relationships that are meaningless or shallow that are then bound in marriages. I do believe that those romantic unions that are substantial are fundamental for civilised order but I am extremely skeptical of marriages that are fake marriages, only ornamentation without any deep substance. I find those like Elective Affinity's Mittler to be rather juvenile and their passions are not compelling; similarly I find passionate detractors of the institution of marriage to be insufferable already.

That is where he tells the world straight out that a number of wars that the neoconservatives in Washington wanted were classified before 9/11. In other words, neoconservatives wanted some wars, and they were planned before any 9/11 occurred. And they were classified. Let me repeat this. Neoconservatives were interested in post-Soviet World Order, and American Order. They planned wars for regime changes in a number of Muslim countries including Iraq, yes before 9/11 happened. Listen from 1:20 onward in this video.

Did you hear his story? Good. Now you actually know something. Before 9/11 there were many wars planned for regime changes in Muslim countries. Let me repeat this so you can understand the concept of time lines. Before 9/11 there were classified war plans by neoconservatives for regime changes in many Muslim countries. In other words before the demolition of the Twin Towers and the strange plane ramming into Pentagon, there were war plans by American planners in Washington. Good you get it.

Now let's revisit what happened. There were no hijackings at all during 9/11 of those planes. You see, Israel knew that Washington had these war plans already, and I conjecture Isser Harel's circle thought, well, the Americans have war plans against Iraq and some other countries. Why don't we just trigger them. So Mossad took control of some passenger jetplanes with remote control devices jutting in the outer body of the planes, rammed them into Twin Towers and Pentagon, and demolished the Twin Towers by explosions, and spread photographs of all sorts of Muslims who allegedly hijacked the planes. Some of these were found within ten days by BBC in other countries. That's right. Some of the alleged hijackers were found alive and BBC interviewed them.

There are several books with more details. But you can read the Bin Laden interview with Ummat where he is quite clear that al Qaeda had nothing to do with it. You can also find that in 1979 Isser Harel directly told Michael Evans the Evangelist Christian that he predicted that Muslims would attack tall buildings in New York. So Israel's Mossad liked this idea that they could do a spectacular show with lots of people dead and blame it on Muslims, and American war plans would be triggered and it would in the long run reduce threat to Israel in the future. And that's what 9/11 was. There was no Muslim terror attack.

You can fool the entire world, US Government, but you cannot fool Zulf with fairy tales. No jihadi or whatever in the entire history of Islam would have actually taken on a totally ridiculous idea, take box cutters to control passenger airlines and crash them into buildings without any strategic demands, without any reason to have crossed the oceans, without any electronic coordination, with a wing and a prayer, and expect to succeed. Israeli Mossad used remote control devices and demolitions. You see that is a better plan overall, than asking jihadi or whoever to take a long shot and expect that lots of them in a coordinated manner without any electronic communication actually would undertake a totally insane idea for no strategic gains and that kills thousands of people who are not even involved in their various liberation struggles far away in the Middle East with no guarantee that anyone would listen to any demands.
