So they may be Jewish but they are untouched by the light of Civilisation. See this is the beginning of Allen Ginsburg's "Howl":

I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness, starving hysterical naked,
dragging themselves through the negro streets at dawn looking for an angry fix,
angelheaded hipsters burning for the ancient heavenly connection to the starry dynamo in the machinery of night,
who poverty and tatters and hollow-eyed and high sat up smoking in the supernatural darkness of cold-water flats floating across the tops of cities contemplating jazz,
who bared their brains to Heaven under the El and saw Mohammedan angels staggering on tenement roofs illuminated,
who passed through universities with radiant cool eyes hallucinating Arkansas and Blake-light tragedy among the scholars of war,
who were expelled from the academies for crazy & publishing obscene odes on the windows of the skull,
who cowered in unshaven rooms in underwear, burning their money in wastebaskets and listening to the Terror through the wall,
who got busted in their pubic beards returning through Laredo with a belt of marijuana for New York,
who ate fire in paint hotels or drank turpentine in Paradise Alley, death, or purgatoried their torsos night after night
with dreams, with drugs, with waking nightmares, alcohol and cock and endless balls,
incomparable blind streets of shuddering cloud and lightning in the mind leaping toward poles of Canada & Paterson, illuminating all the motionless world of Time between,
Peyote solidities of halls, backyard green tree cemetery dawns, wine drunkenness over the rooftops, storefront boroughs of teahead joyride neon blinking traffic light, sun and moon and tree vibrations in the roaring winter dusks of Brooklyn, ashcan rantings and kind king light of mind,
who chained themselves to subways for the endless ride from Battery to holy Bronx on benzedrine until the noise of wheels and children brought them down shuddering mouth-wracked and battered bleak of brain all drained of brilliance in the drear light of Zoo,
who sank all night in submarine light of Bickford’s floated out and sat through the stale beer afternoon in desolate Fugazzi’s, listening to the crack of doom on the hydrogen jukebox,
who talked continuously seventy hours from park to pad to bar to Bellevue to museum to the Brooklyn Bridge,
a lost battalion of platonic conversationalists jumping down the stoops off fire escapes off windowsills off Empire State out of the moon,
yacketayakking screaming vomiting whispering facts and memories and anecdotes and eyeball kicks and shocks of hospitals and jails and wars,
whole intellects disgorged in total recall for seven days and nights with brilliant eyes, meat for the Synagogue cast on the pavement,
who vanished into nowhere Zen New Jersey leaving a trail of ambiguous picture postcards of Atlantic City Hall,
suffering Eastern sweats and Tangerian bone-grindings and migraines of China under junk-withdrawal in Newark’s bleak furnished room,   
who wandered around and around at midnight in the railroad yard wondering where to go, and went, leaving no broken hearts,
who lit cigarettes in boxcars boxcars boxcars racketing through snow toward lonesome farms in grandfather night,
who studied Plotinus Poe St. John of the Cross telepathy and bop kabbalah because the cosmos instinctively vibrated at their feet in Kansas,   
who loned it through the streets of Idaho seeking visionary indian angels who were visionary indian angels,
who thought they were only mad when Baltimore gleamed in supernatural ecstasy,
who jumped in limousines with the Chinaman of Oklahoma on the impulse of winter midnight streetlight smalltown rain,
who lounged hungry and lonesome through Houston seeking jazz or sex or soup, and followed the brilliant Spaniard to converse about America and Eternity, a hopeless task, and so took ship to Africa,
who disappeared into the volcanoes of Mexico leaving behind nothing but the shadow of dungarees and the lava and ash of poetry scattered in fireplace Chicago,
who reappeared on the West Coast investigating the FBI in beards and shorts with big pacifist eyes sexy in their dark skin passing out incomprehensible leaflets,
who burned cigarette holes in their arms protesting the narcotic tobacco haze of Capitalism,
who distributed Supercommunist pamphlets in Union Square weeping and undressing while the sirens of Los Alamos wailed them down, and wailed down Wall, and the Staten Island ferry also wailed,
who broke down crying in white gymnasiums naked and trembling before the machinery of other skeletons,
who bit detectives in the neck and shrieked with delight in policecars for committing no crime but their own wild cooking pederasty and intoxication,
who howled on their knees in the subway and were dragged off the roof waving genitals and manuscripts,
who let themselves be fucked in the ass by saintly motorcyclists, and screamed with joy,
who blew and were blown by those human seraphim, the sailors, caresses of Atlantic and Caribbean love,
who balled in the morning in the evenings in rosegardens and the grass of public parks and cemeteries scattering their semen freely to whomever come who may,
who hiccuped endlessly trying to giggle but wound up with a sob behind a partition in a Turkish Bath when the blond & naked angel came to pierce them with a sword,
who lost their loveboys to the three old shrews of fate the one eyed shrew of the heterosexual dollar the one eyed shrew that winks out of the womb and the one eyed shrew that does nothing but sit on her ass and snip the intellectual golden threads of the craftsman’s loom,
who copulated ecstatic and insatiate with a bottle of beer a sweetheart a package of cigarettes a candle and fell off the bed, and continued along the floor and down the hall and ended fainting on the wall with a vision of ultimate cunt and come eluding the last gyzym of consciousness,
who sweetened the snatches of a million girls trembling in the sunset, and were red eyed in the morning but prepared to sweeten the snatch of the sunrise, flashing buttocks under barns and naked in the lake,
who went out whoring through Colorado in myriad stolen night-cars, N.C., secret hero of these poems, cocksman and Adonis of Denver—joy to the memory of his innumerable lays of girls in empty lots & diner backyards, moviehouses’ rickety rows, on mountaintops in caves or with gaunt waitresses in familiar roadside lonely petticoat upliftings & especially secret gas-station solipsisms of johns, & hometown alleys too,
who faded out in vast sordid movies, were shifted in dreams, woke on a sudden Manhattan, and picked themselves up out of basements hung-over with heartless Tokay and horrors of Third Avenue iron dreams & stumbled to unemployment offices,
who walked all night with their shoes full of blood on the snowbank docks waiting for a door in the East River to open to a room full of steam-heat and opium,
who created great suicidal dramas on the apartment cliff-banks of the Hudson under the wartime blue floodlight of the moon & their heads shall be crowned with laurel in oblivion,
who ate the lamb stew of the imagination or digested the crab at the muddy bottom of the rivers of Bowery,
who wept at the romance of the streets with their pushcarts full of onions and bad music,
who sat in boxes breathing in the darkness under the bridge, and rose up to build harpsichords in their lofts,
who coughed on the sixth floor of Harlem crowned with flame under the tubercular sky surrounded by orange crates of theology,

See, that's what I am talking about. He is an American Jewish man by birth, but he became Buddhist. That's what I am talking about. We're American. item.title: WHAT IS SPECIAL ABOUT ROMANTICISM
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Romanticism has from its very beginning been about answering a deep calling of the poet to fulfill a need, a need that was based on intolerable dissatisfaction with the way that the world is and the way that it could be. By and large the dissatisfaction stems from a strong feeling that the way the world is does not make any sense for there is a concealing of some human potential in it that produces dissonance, disharmony, and that it is the poet's birthright to mend this situation. We see this in a rapturous and ecstatic mysticism of William Blake and most purely in Percy Bysshe Shelley. And this is what draws others, like myself, in the orbit of Romanticism. I consider Thomas Stearns Eliot a Romantic Modern for this impulse as well, for The Waste Land was a meditation of healing the world after the devastation of First World War, of taking stock of who we are, and putting down the fragments of our soul from West to East. Rilke too was a Romantic Modern, and his project to bringing wholeness was far more spiritual and left behind 'our interpreted world' as mostly irrelevant for the vast unity of existence. The Romantic project is not Utopian in the sense of planned paradise but much more serious. Utopian projects always fail for they continuously misjudge and trivialise human nature and therefore end up being a tyrannical nightmare that compels their destruction sooner or later. For me these things are quite clear and easy to understand because we are a species of 200 million years of evolution whose variety and nature are still shrouded in darkness, and stick models of humans are all that Utopian projects utilise -- including that of Communists, and that of Capitalism too. We are still in the dark concerning out deep souls, of all its Heaven and all its Hell and what modulates them.

item.title: KATHY HOCHUL GOVERNER OF NEW YORK QUERIES PRINCETON ABOUT ZULF'S ACADEMIC RECORD
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
[latexpage]

I am most pleased that Kathy Hochul, the Governor of New York is querying Princeton University about my academic record. My record was quite good there with numerous graduate courses in Mathematics and a strong complement of Literature courses, and of course I won the prize for most original senior thesis in Mathematics for 1995, which was on decoupled pseudoconvex domains with a noncompact group of automorphisms. This was good work, and I used some nice analysis too to prove some results in several complex variables. As my readers surely know, the Riemann mapping theorem fails in $\mathbf{C}^n$ for $n>1$ and the notion of pseudoconvexity arose to find geometric conditions for invariance under biholomorphisms. My work was a new theorem about characterising those pseudoconvex domains whose group of automorphisms is not compact. Years later, in 2008, I was obsessed with the historical convictions of William Rowan Hamilton on how quaternions will change all of physics and thought that the four-sphere as the quaternionic projective line would reveal to us the structure of physical existence. And it did, in the end, some decade later, in penury, on disability income exiled out of civilisation in Allen Texas, in my aunt's home.

There is little question that Four-Sphere Theory, the most significant advance in theoretical physics over work of Albert Einstein, James Clerk Maxwell, and Erwin Schroedinger, would not have succeeded without my fine education at Princeton. In fact, it is a purely mathematical physics in ways that quantum theory and general relativity could not be, and it not only solved the equivalent of unified field theory search by Hermann Weyl and Albert Einstein, both of whom died in 1955, but also replaced gravity and overthrew Big Bang Cosmology and expansion. It is the Final Theory of Macroscopic Physics, and it is my work.

item.title: SOME THOUGHTS ABOUT JORDAN PETERSON'S CRITIQUE OF COMMUNIST MANIFESTO
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: [latexpage]I liked some of the points Jordan Peterson brings out about assumptions of Communist Manifesto. History is indeed incorrectly seen just as economic class struggle. Let tell you a different sort of way to see history. Let time be labelled in years and $t \in [-75000,0]$ where zero represents the present. That's historical time. Then you consider history to be an agglomeration of on a network of nodes each node representing a human being. Then we consider the inner and outer life of all these people with a network of $N(0)=8\times 10^9$ nodes at the end, and these are all the people's ancestral history of the world. That's the history of the people of the world. There are many ways of understanding this outrageously intractable amount of things. You could just pay attention to some aspects, such as whether each person was virtuous in their every act every minute and aggregate the total number of virtuous acts across time and maybe if you're like me you like the human race and you cross your fingers and want to see that on average virtuous human being increased over time in history. And for me, this is more interesting than seeing history as one of class struggle. That's too limited for me to find human race as interesting. I am not an example of a man in any class struggle. Ah, you say, Bill Gates stopped you from success, so you are in struggle as a poor man against rich. No no no no no. I am higher class than the snot-nosed illiterate hick huckster Bill Gates. Never confuse this. I am not in any class struggle with Bill Gates. Bill Gates might be in some lower class struggling with me, but he's just inferior charlatan who is not as good as me. I am fine with becoming wealthier than him because I deserve much more privilege than him. Marx and Engels were not talking about moi.

item.title: ZULF'S LONG TERM VIRTUE INCREASE THEORY
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I will hypothesize that however you define Virtue of individuals, the average Virtue, i.e. mean Virtue of total population over time has monotonically increased in the past 75,000 years. The reasons are many but most importantly it is because women prefer more Virtuous men in direct and indirect ways as mates and so there is a deep evolutionary driving force for it, and this is part of Human Nature, the increase of Virtue over time, and this is independent of religion and ethnicity.

This theory is not to counter Marxist history etc. but I believe will be true, and verifiable in measurements. This sort of thing is absolutely key to formulating the right sort of political theory for actual world. We need to have some understanding of the Human Nature at the aggregate that is solid clear and trustworthy. All our confusions of past centuries has to do with not understanding clearly what is true about Human Nature in a solid manner rather than relying on the thoughts of sages and wise men such as Rousseau, Locke, and Kant and Adam Smith. These men speculated and theorised but did not have clear empirical measurements to check whether their theories were good or not.

I like Jordan Peterson, but he is obsessed with the idea that hierarchies are so central to history either. In fact, they are also accidental and I don't think all that important. There is hierarchy one day, dissolution the next day, another one next day, and these are not stable over time at all. What drives history is not winner take all competition. What drives people is just life, however life is, sometimes in hierarchies, sometimes in conflicts, and options change from season to season, centuries to centuries. One day you are deep in the middle of climbing some hierarchy with deep focus for a decade. The next day you meet a woman who take you by the hand and shows you some wild new world where none of the people you were fighting for dominant position matter any more. Suddenly you are a new man with a bigger dream mocking hierarchy that meant the world to you. That is what we're like about hierarchies. They are important until they are not important.

Now for Jordan Peterson's own life, he has a certain hierarchical status, he's a professor of psychology, a well-known figure, has some respectability and is someone in a hierarchy in a spot he likes. So he likes his hierarchical spot. So then he wants a universal theory from his particular box. But hierarchy is extremely variable in life. You can find it, but you can find people talking past each other. My aunt is in all manner of hierarchy and is disrespectful to me routinely. She says it's my house and I can treat Zulf badly and he's subordinate to me. That's her reality. I will talk about how Goldman can be sued for $100 bn for anti-Muslim religious persecution and shut her down with I went to Princeton I know this better than you. And she will humpf where I pulled rank on her. It does not matter to me that she will mistreat me with all manner of subordinate treatment to me. I'll pull rank on her from American education when I need to. See hierarchy is tied to narcissism too. She's narcissistic and feels a need to try to put me down. And I will tolerate that sometimes and pull rank on her as I need and I will keep looking for the money blockaded by Bill Gates such as from D. E. Shaw or Madam Lagarde because I don't belong here at all and I need my own place and my own life in San Francisco because I am not only not subordinate to her but do not belong in her world at all. See, there is no natural hierarchy. Hierarchy is a matter of some compromise and not much more. Mr. Peterson's contentions about biological drive to hierarchy is not compelling to me at all. In fact historically social status in humans grew with divine and holiness, and not from the sort of biological dominance that Mr. Peterson has in mind. Respect is a fundamental psychological need, but hierarchy is quite fluid and constantly contested. And this is human nature to contest them a lot as well.

Human beings are comfortable with egalitarianism to strong hierarchical organisation in a spectrum, but the comfort level changes and is fluid. Sophisticated cultures not just in East but West find ways of respectfulness towards people not to demean them in ways that would produce immediate conflict. And that is not new. In India Namaste was my divine within bows to yours. That's just one example. There are various diplomatic ways of being respectful without being obsequious. These are forms that humans have developed to avoid a primitive reliance on gorilla dominance, the biological type that Civilisations will find to crude and primitive. So we have seen these forms, and Christian teachings will not differ from Eastern religions in being able to respect people who are of different socioeconomic status or profession.

item.title: ZULF HAS NO APOLOGIES FOR CURSING AT ANYONE AT ALL WITH EXPLICIT EXCEPTIONS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I am 48 years old and I am not a teenager. I have no apologies for using swear words and other expletives in public speech at whoever I feel like. None whatsoever. I will use whatever language that I feel is appropriate, low high, lots of cunts in a sentence, etc. I don't give a damn really what the reaction is. Some might get me killed one day. Or no one might care. In either case I have no apology for them, do not feel they are inappropriate, and have not guilty feelings about them, and don't really think they matter all that much either. Especially with Bill Gates I believe all cursing is perfectly fine with no apology ever offered.

I consider cursing and threatening all sorts of things to large groups and institutions to be anonymous and therefore not really all that problematic at all. I am careful to do this with named people unless they had harmed me. I don't generally curse or use aggressive language against named people who have not done me wrong. You see, it's natural for me. The way I see things, I am virtuous, and I do the right thing naturally, including fine tuned cuts on cursing too. Now you might not think so, but I don't particularly care what you think unless you address me directly and we are in a direct conversation. People will have whatever judgments they have; none of it matters to me. I am me, and will be myself, and am comfortable with who I am.

I am literal. I am not trying to be funny; in fact funny is mysterious and who knows what is funny to whom? I speak to the entire human race without discrimination in my blog. I don't ask 'will they accept this or that?' Instead, I trust that whatever comes to me is right, just, good, perfect, for I am Zulf, and I am virtuous and accept myself without need for approval of anyone.

I am amazed how far Schroedinger got, because if you start with Four-Sphere theory, and then you look at what he accomplished to get close to it, you will be quite impressed with his genius. His genius was extraordinary, but Four-Sphere Theory is truth, not Schroedinger theory. So Thomas Bernhard tells the US Government officials, "What are you doing? He's a great genius. He's American. Why are you listening to Bill Gates?" Thomas Bernhard, great job. item.title: THOUGHTS ABOUT MICROSOFT AND BILL GATES
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Microsoft has had some good people, and I like Satya Nadella. But Microsoft had produced third rate operating systems from the very beginning. Apple fared a bit better, and without a doubt Linux is the best operating system in existence and Ubuntu 20 is just gorgeous. Microsoft is like prison food compared to the luxurious gourmet of Linux. Granted, the commercial polish is missing for products for Linux but it is a fine operating system, and inner beauty is breathtaking. It is a marvel in elegance and efficiency, and I would never ever use a Microsoft Windows product for serious work, and never have. My personal work and even games I play are on Linux. I consider this a matter of cultivation and good taste. I could do something to make Excel and other relatively valuable Microsoft contributions -- and of course Bill Gates did no coding at all in any -- to a higher level easily but I will not squander my genius. I have some genius and I will instead spend it on serious problems like Global Life Satisfaction, difficult but tractible problems of Science and Humanities. Some technology will come into play, and it will be great technology like Mesos and not the third rate shoddy technology of Microsoft.

item.title: ZULF EXAMINES MY GRATITUDE TOWARDS MADAM CHRISTINE LAGARDE OF ECB
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com

item.title: HISTORY OF USCIS
item.dc:creator: zulfikar.ahmed@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
The following is just from USCIS website.

USCIS has a legacy of more than 100 years of federal immigration and naturalization administration. 

Federal oversight of immigration began in 1891, when Congress created the first Office of Immigration in the Treasury Department. As immigration grew over the following decades, so did the duties of federal immigration employees. By 1906, lawmakers voted to reform the nation’s pathway to citizenship, and the Bureau of Immigration added oversight of naturalization to its responsibilities.

The next major transformation came during the Great Depression in 1933, when the president ordered the consolidation of federal immigration and naturalization functions into the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS). INS oversaw the immigration process, enforcement, and border patrol activities for seventy years until Congress passed the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (Pub. L. No. 107–296, 116 Stat. 2135).

On March 1, 2003, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) assumed responsibility for the immigration service functions of the federal government. USCIS was founded to enhance the security and efficiency of national immigration services by focusing exclusively on the administration of benefit applications. The Homeland Security Act created Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to oversee immigration enforcement and border security.  

Now let us consider the following issue. The issue of who is American and who is not American is not a trivial matter and has been a political issue from even before 1891 when the first Federal agency was created to handle immigration and naturalisation. I have an American permanent residency, so I have passed through the requisite requirements. I am in conflict with Bill Gates and I claim I am far more eligible to be an American than he is. USCIS, and not Bill Gates, decides who is American and who is not American and represents the outcome of the legislative processes of a Multi-Ethnic Classical Liberal Democratic Republic. If Bill Gates feels that only white people ought to be American, he has one vote and whatever powers he can muster to try to change the laws governing USCIS, but I can guarantee that his view is democratically too weak as most American people do not share the view that only white people can be American Citizens.
